text: so it's all eyes on Brazil for the World
Cup
but while the globe tries to contain its
excitement it's another story in the
host country according to a new survey
by the Pew Research Center nearly
three-quarters of Brazilians aren't
happy with their country's direction a
big number for sure but check this out
it's leaped from 55 percent just a year
ago people's top rated concerns were
things like rising prices crime
healthcare and political corruption now
these have long been sources of
frustration but Pew Research
characterized today's discontent has
unmatched in recent years most
Brazilians said that the world cup won't
help matters one bit about 6 and 10
think hosting the event sucks money away
from crucial public services now just
about 3 and 10 think it's a good thing
because of job creation now you might
remember those mass demonstrations
across the country in 2013 protesting
economic conditions among other
grievances few research found that 48%
of Brazilians think they damaged the
country's international reputation so
could the World Cup rectify this for the
host well just 35 percent of Brazilians
said the World Cup will help the
country's global image and 39 percent
said the football tournament will hurt
its image
David Botti BBC News Washington
